text:
News, Articles & Videos

Mirai will be a guest judge on Season 11, episode 6 (“The Draglympics”) of VH1’s “RuPaul’s Drag Race” to be broadcast on Thursday, April 4, 2019 at 9 pm Eastern/8 pm Central – Mirai’s Instagram shows what she’ll be wearing on the show.

Article: Who is Mirai Nagasu? Everything you need to know about RuPaul’s guest judge! (RealityTitbit.com, April 3, 2019).

Mirai will return as a full-time cast member of the 2019 U.S. STARS ON ICE presented by Musselman’s tour [as announced in this Feb. 7th press release]. Visit her Skating page for the full list of 13 tour dates & locations (April 18-May 18,2019).

On May 26, 2018, Mirai was honored by Pop Warner with their Female Achievement Award in Orlando, Florida. According to the Pop Warner Little Scholars website, their 58th Annual Pop Warner Scholastic Banquet “recognizes its top scholar-athletes and deserving adults in the sports industry who have contributed to the advancement of academics and/or athletics.” The evening before, at the Professional Skaters Association’s annual ‘EDI’ awards dinner on May 25, Mirai was announced as the winner of the Sonja Henie Award, which is “Presented to a female, professional skater who has brought recognition to the sport in a positive and favorable manner.”

Dancing with the Stars & Stars on Ice tour:

Mirai participated in the May 21st Dancing with the Stars; Athletes Finale’s All Cast number at the end of the show – the camera focuses on her and Alan dancing together at the 40-second mark of this 1:35-minute video on DWTS’ YouTube channel.

Mirai shared a 2-part message about her DWTS experience on her Instagram (May 20): [Post 1] & [Post 2].

WEEK 3 VIDEOS: Mirai and Alan dance a Quickstep to “Bo$$” by Ray Chew Live dedicated to her MVP mom, Ikuko (Official DWTS YouTube channel, May 14)

In round 2, Mirai & Alan squared off in a Ballroom Battle Dance-Off against Adam Rippon & Jenna Johnson with both teams dancing a Jive to Johnny B. Goode” by Chuck Berry: [Watch the dance-off here].
